prior_accusations.context: Banished for witchcraft 7 years before trial; denounced two particularly bad witches at Leintrey to Commandeur of Gelaucourt - identified as Mathieu Margeron and la Jobarde

notable_quotes.speaker: Marguerite Jobarde to Michiel Hellenix
notable_quotes.french: qu'il ne le deust faire que ledit Sr Curé estoit trop mauvais et avoit par trop cousté aux habitants a faire bastir la maison de la cure, que personne ne debvoit marchander a luy de charroyer ses dismes plustost qu'on les debvroit laisser perdre et pourrir aux champs. Enfin apres plusieurs propos plus entre eulx ladite Jobarde dict a luy qui depose qu'il estoit bien sot d'entreprendre et de charroyer de lesdit dismes qu'elle avoit ouy dire a son maitre que tous ceulx qui le charroyent y perdroient de leurs chevaux avant qu'ils soient totalement engraingés
notable_quotes.english: he should not do it, that the Curé was too wicked and had cost the inhabitants too much to build the house of the cure, that no one should bargain with him to cart his tithes rather they should leave them to be lost and rot in the fields. Finally after several more words between them the said Jobarde said to him who deposes that he was very foolish to undertake to cart the said tithes, that she had heard from her master that all those who cart them would lose their horses before they are totally gathered in
notable_quotes.context: Threat regarding carting tithes for curé

notable_quotes.speaker: Marguerite Jobarde to Estienne Cougnat
notable_quotes.context: After he agreed to having made comments about her

notable_quotes.speaker: Demenge Grand Colas to Marguerite Jobarde
notable_quotes.french: mort dieu sorciere sy tu bouges je te creveray les deux yeulx avec ma forme
notable_quotes.english: by God witch if you move I will burst both your eyes with my form [tool]
notable_quotes.context: Confrontation when she tried to strike him with an ell after he hired her former servant and called her witch

notable_quotes.speaker: Marguerite Jobarde about Nicolas Demenge Mongin
notable_quotes.french: que s'en estoit un bon des appostres cestuy-la... que c'estoit un genot, et que son pere estoit le Roy, et un nommé Toussainct son frere
notable_quotes.english: that was a fine apostle that one... that it was a bastard, and that his father was the King, and one named Toussainct his brother
notable_quotes.context: Accusations made against witness during interrogation

notable_quotes.speaker: Jean Courtier about Marguerite Jobarde
notable_quotes.french: Toutesfois que depuis ledit temps elle a tousjours tasché de complaire et faire croire audit deposant qu'elle ne luy vouloit aucun mal
notable_quotes.english: However since that time she has always tried to please and make the deponent believe that she wished him no harm
notable_quotes.context: After his horse died following quarrel

economic_context.details: Lawsuit between community and her late husband over a path through his field he had tried to close. Under torture, confessed to killing her son Vaultrin because he failed to repay loan of 100 francs; also killed animals belonging to her son Colas who had also borrowed money from her. Evidently a relatively rich woman - property confiscation yielded significant sums: son paid 1,283 Fr for remission of confiscated goods, prévôt allowed 600 Fr, gardener allowed 200 Fr. Wage dispute with servant Jehenne Vannier. Owed 4 gros to Nicolas Estienne but only paid 2.

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She came asking to buy grain

harms_catalog.harm_description: 1 horse died, 1 horse went lame and ceased to work properly
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Agreement to cart tithes for curé; she said those who cart them would lose horses

harms_catalog.harm_description: Right eye became very painful and watered profusely; effectively lost sight in that eye
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Refused to work for her next day as already engaged elsewhere

harms_catalog.victim_name: Approximately 50 lambs belonging to Marguerite veuve Demenge Jacquemin
harms_catalog.harm_description: Ewes lost milk after 3 weeks so that all lambs died
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused had been in her house most evenings without good cause
Lawsuit between community and her late husband over path through field
harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after they blamed him for the case

harms_catalog.harm_description: Legs swollen and painful so he could not work; lasted 3 months, in great pain, constantly crying
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She threatened 'qu'il s'en donneroit de garde' after he spoke of her preventing marriage

harms_catalog.harm_description: Illness lasting 3 months - great pain, constantly crying, nothing helped
Ill for a fortnight with headache, then pains in shoulder and leg
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Forced witness to drink perry against her will

harms_catalog.victim_name: 11 cattle belonging to Demenge Grand Colas
harms_catalog.harm_description: Loss of 11 cattle; some became so disturbed they were frightened to keep them in the house

harms_catalog.time_between_quarrel_and_harm: after being overtaken by whirlwind in fields

harms_catalog.victim_name: Horse belonging to Jean Marchal's father
harms_catalog.harm_description: Horse became ill, 'frenetique' and trying to bite him, then died completely emaciated
harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: Accused of theft by witches including Jobarde; horse race where he lost to Jobarde's husband's horse
harms_catalog.method_alleged: witchcraft/evil eye (he saw her and her sister in fields and feared harm)

harms_catalog.harm_description: Injured in fall when cutting down tree brought down by sudden great gust of wind; bedridden for 6 weeks

harms_catalog.precipitating_quarrel: She was angry because he had rented some fields

material_culture.context: Came to Bastien Bacourt's house asking to buy grain
Thought she had used powder to kill 2 horses
Agreement to cart tithes for curé
She tried to strike Grand Colas with an ell
Grand Colas threatened to burst her eyes with his forme
Came to house of Jean Gadel wanting to try perry with intention of buying it; forced witness to drink some
Curé of Reillon sent servant with herbs to get la Jobarde to recognize and touch them
Asked about use of dog's head for swellings in animals; Colin l'escorcheur told her to get one and have it blessed; neither curé nor chaplain would bless it so she threw it away
Tried to keep servant Jehenne Vannier's clothes when she left service; forced to give them up after legal complaint
Soldier (her master/devil) was angry at loss of his hat and threatened to make her pay for it
Rumour she paid 80 francs for release from Commandeur of Gelaucourt
Legal settlement where Nicolas Mongeron paid 10 francs for legal costs
She paid 14 francs for supper in legal settlement
Owed Nicolas Estienne 4 gros for work but only gave 2
Demanded from servant Jehenne Vannier for each day of absence due to illness
Believed to have paid about 20 écus for release from arrest at Gelaucourt
Loan to her son Vaultrin which he failed to repay; confessed to killing him for this
Son paid costs and this amount for remission of confiscated goods
Witness had about 50 sheep which looked well before ewes lost milk
3 pigs died during Estienne Cougnat's illness
Multiple horses died or became ill; used for work and racing ('courir les esguillettes')
11 cattle lost by Grand Colas

Where accused spent first year in service
Pilgrimage destination (accused's initial excuse for trip to Gelaucourt)
Where whirlwind overtook Nicolas Barbe; where Jean Marchal saw accused and her sister; where curé found accused and another woman dancing; where tree-cutting accident occurred
Subject of lawsuit between community and Demenge Waultrin; he tried to close it
Had taken a lot of their meadow (mentioned in confession about killing pigs)
Geographic reference point for identifying witches: 'grosse qui se tenoit a l'endroit de l'eglise', 'gros homme derrier ladite eglise', 'femme au dessoubz d'icelle'
First sabbat 3 months after seduction where accomplices were seen

historical_context.military_details: Seduction occurred 20 years earlier when soldiers were in village; soldier leader was lodged in her house and became her master/devil

sudden great gust of wind that brought down tree injuring Jean Marchal

community concern over cost of building curé's house

prior_legal_disputes.description: Lawsuit between community and her late husband Demenge Waultrin over a path through his field he had tried to close
Nicolas Mongeron called her son 'fils de genoxe' after finding him beating his son; taken before justice of Blamont

prior_legal_disputes.description: Servant Jehenne Vannier sought legal action when Jobarde tried to keep her clothes
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Grand Colas went to Prévôt at Blamont; Jobarde obliged to give up clothes while paying servant for service done

prior_legal_disputes.description: Arrested at Gelaucourt on grounds of being witch fleeing from justice after reports from Jean Bon Claude
prior_legal_disputes.outcome: Had to pay for release - either 80 francs or 20 écus depending on source

legal_context.imprisonment_conditions: Locked up at Gelaucourt; released by Michiel Breton who drew bolt of door from outside

hearsay_chains.source: Mre Jean Dommerey, curé of Reillon
hearsay_chains.content: Heard curé say that when out for a walk he had found la Jobarde and another woman dancing in the fields

hearsay_chains.source: Jean Bon Claude via Commandeur of Gelaucourt
hearsay_chains.content: Jean Bon Claude denounced two particularly bad witches at Leintrey deserving burning more than him
Nicolas Demenge Mongin was illegitimate, father was the King, brother named Toussainct; father took something 'pour luy servir de bombarde au sabat'

emotional_state_notes: During confrontations accused witnesses of being 'bourdiere', 'ribaulde', 'meschant homme'
Maintained to last that 3 she had accused were witches

reproaches_to_witnesses.objection: Accused Margueritte veuve Demenge Jacquemin of being 'une bourdiere et une ribaulde'
Said Demenge le Grand Colas was 'un meschant homme' but would not make specific allegations
Claimed to have heard that Estienne Connot had stolen some wood; he denied this
Said of Nicolas Demenge Mongin 'que s'en estoit un bon des appostres cestuy-la' and accused him of being illegitimate, calling him 'genot' and claiming his father was the King

extraction_metadata.notes: Very detailed trial record with extensive witness testimony documenting 30-year reputation. Notable for: (1) prior denunciation by previously banished witch Jean Bon Claude; (2) extensive economic context showing accused was relatively wealthy woman with property, loans to sons, wage disputes; (3) confession under torture included killing her own sons for debt; (4) multiple witnesses reported long-standing reputation and pattern of quarrels followed by harm; (5) property confiscation yielded substantial sums (1,283 Fr + 600 Fr + 200 Fr); (6) torture used with moderation for age; (7) accomplice denunciations varied between torture sessions, suggesting unreliability; (8) maintained innocence until torture, then confessed to maléfices mostly different from accusations; (9) maintained to death that 3 accused were witches.
